Event selection

[1]:

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
from sklearn.neighbors import KernelDensity
import ler
from ler import LeR

[2]:

# callin class
ler_ = LeR(npool=6,z_min=0., z_max=10.,snr_type = 'interpolation',\
           psds={'L1':'aLIGOaLIGODesignSensitivityT1800044','H1':'aLIGOaLIGODesignSensitivityT1800044','V1':'AdvVirgo'}, \
           waveform_inspiral_must_be_above_fmin=True)

Given: IMR waveform
given psds:  {'L1': 'aLIGOaLIGODesignSensitivityT1800044', 'H1': 'aLIGOaLIGODesignSensitivityT1800044', 'V1': 'AdvVirgo'}
getting stored interpolator...
In case if you need regeneration of interpolator of the given gwsnr param, please delete this file, ./interpolator_pickle/halfSNR_dict_1.pickle

[3]:

ler_.selecting_n_detectable_events?

Signature:
ler_.selecting_n_detectable_events(
    snr_threshold=8.0,
    num_img=2,
    none_as_nan=True,
    lensed=True,
    jsonFile=True,
    lenstype='I',
    new=False,
    size=100,
    min_img=2,
    max_img=4,
    batch_size=10000,
    **kwargs,
)
Docstring:
Function to select n detectable events
Input parameters:
    snr_threshold (float): the threshold for the SNR
    num_img (int): the number of images
    none_as_nan (bool): if True, then replace None with np.nan
    lensed (bool): if True, then select lensed events
    jsonFile (bool): if True, then save the dictionary as a json file
    lenstype (str): the lens type
                    e.g. 'I' for image type I, 'II' for image type II, 'III' for image type III, 'any' for any type
    new (bool): if True, then sample new events
    size (int): the number of events to be sampled
    min_img (int): the minimum number of images
    max_img (int): the maximum number of images
    batch_size (int): the number of events to be sampled in each iteration
Output parameters:
    param (dict): the dictionary containing the parameters of the selected events
File:      ~/phd/mypackages/ler/ler/ler.py
Type:      method

n event generation

4 image lensed: 2 detectable Type I

param1 = ler_.selecting_n_detectable_events(lenstype='I',snr_threshold=8.0, num_img=2, new=True, min_img=4, size=1000, batch_size=10000)

comparision

[6]:

# magnification
# type I
amp = param1['magnifications']
amp1_1 = amp[:,0]
amp1_2 = amp[:,1]
dmu12 = abs(amp1_2-amp1_1)
# type II
amp = param2['magnifications']
amp2_1 = amp[:,2]
amp2_2 = amp[:,3]
dmu23 = abs(amp2_2-amp1_1)

# time delays
# type I
dt = param1['time_delays']/(60*60*24) #
delay1_1 = dt[:,0]
delay1_2 = dt[:,1]
dt12 = abs(delay1_2-delay1_1)
# type II
dt = param2['time_delays']/(60*60*24)
delay2_1 = dt[:,2]
delay2_2 = dt[:,3]
dt23 = abs(delay2_2-delay2_1)

relative time delays

[7]:

min_ = -4
max_ = 4
# type I
x12 = np.log10(dt12)
kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
kde.fit(x12[:, np.newaxis])
x_d = np.linspace(min_, max_, 1000)
logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])
plt.fill_between(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.5)
plt.plot(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-')
# type II
x23 = np.log10(dt23)
kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
kde.fit(x23[:, np.newaxis])
x_d = np.linspace(min_, max_, 1000)
logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])
plt.fill_between(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.5)
plt.plot(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-')

plt.xscale('log')
plt.ylabel('pdf')
plt.xlabel('days')
plt.title('Time delay between same image type in 4 image events')
plt.show()

[8]:

dt  = param1['time_delays']
image = np.log10(np.array([dt[:,1],dt[:,2],dt[:,3]])/(24*60*60))

for i in range(len(image)):
    x_train = image[i]
    kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
    kde.fit(x_train[:, np.newaxis])
    min_ = -4
    max_ = 4
    x_d = np.linspace(min_, max_, 1000)
    logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])

    name = 'Image '+ str(i+2)
    #plt.fill_between(x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.3)
    plt.plot(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-', alpha=0.4, label=name)

x_train = np.log10(np.concatenate((dt[:,1],dt[:,2],dt[:,3]))/(24*60*60))
kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
kde.fit(x_train[:, np.newaxis])
min_ = -4
max_ = 4
x_d = np.linspace(min_, max_, 1000)
logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])

name = 'Image all'
#plt.fill_between(x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.3)
plt.plot(10**x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-', alpha=0.8, label=name)

#plt.xlim(0.00001,5)
#plt.ylim(0,0.2)
plt.xscale('log')
plt.ylabel('pdf')
plt.xlabel('days')
plt.title('Time delay wrt to 1st image')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

relative magnification

[18]:

x_train = np.log10(dmu23)
kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
kde.fit(x_train[:, np.newaxis])
min_ = np.min(x_train)
max_ = np.max(x_train)
x_d = np.linspace(-1, 3, 1000)
logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])

name = 'Image '+ str(i+2)
plt.fill_between(x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.3, label=r'$ImgType=II$')
plt.plot(x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-', alpha=0.6)

x_train = np.log10(dmu12)
kde = KernelDensity(bandwidth=1, kernel='gaussian')
kde.fit(x_train[:, np.newaxis])
min_ = np.min(x_train)
max_ = np.max(x_train)
#x_d = np.linspace(min_, max_, 1000)
logprob = kde.score_samples(x_d[:, np.newaxis])

name = 'Image '+ str(i+2)
plt.fill_between(x_d, np.exp(logprob), alpha=0.3, label=r'$ImgType=I$')
plt.plot(x_d, np.exp(logprob), '-', alpha=0.6)

#plt.xlim(0,10)
plt.ylabel(r'pdf')
plt.xlabel(r'log(relative $\mu$)')
plt.legend()
plt.title('relative magnification between same \n image type in 4 image events')
plt.show()
